questiontext.text:
Electrochemistry (10 points)

Warning! The correct form of the scientific notation is 1000 = e3; 1234 = 1.234e3; 0.1234 = 1.234e-1

We construct the following galvanic cell which operates at 18.41 \(^\circ\) C: a copper plate is dipped into a copper-sulfate solution ( c\(_{\text{Cu}^{2+}}\) = 0.0480 mol/dm3 ), and an iron plate is immersed into an iron-sulfate solution (c\(_{\text{Fe}^{2+}}\) = 0.151 mol/dm\(^3\)).

What will be the cell reaction if we connect the two half cells? Justify your answer!

What will be the Gibbs free energy, the enthalpy, and entropy change at 18.41 \(^\circ\)C ?

\( (\frac{dE}{dT})_{p} \) = -7.5587e-4 V/K, K\(_{ 18.41 ^{\circ}\text{C} } \) = 9.6631e22 , the mean activity coefficient is one, standard electrode potentials at 24.99 \(^{\circ}\)C : \( \varepsilon_{\text{Fe/Fe}^{2+}}^{\circ} = -0.45 \) V and \( \varepsilon_{\text{Cu/Cu}^{2+}}^{\circ} = 0.55 \) V. (F = \( 96485 \) C/mol, R = \( 8,314 \) J/(molK), p\(^\circ\) = \( 100 \) kPa, 0\(^\circ\)C = \( 273,15 \) K)

Please calculate the following quantities and answer to the questions:

a) What is the cathode reaction and its Nernst equation? (1 point)

1:
\( \text{Fe}^{2+} + 2 ~\text{e}^- \longrightarrow \text{Fe} \hphantom{kkk} \\ \varepsilon_{c} = \varepsilon^{\circ}_{c} - \frac{RT}{zF} \text{ln} a_{\text{Fe}^{2+}} \)
2:
\( \text{Fe}^{2+} + 2 ~\text{e}^- \longrightarrow \text{Fe} \hphantom{kkk} \\ \varepsilon_{c} = \varepsilon^{\circ}_{c} - \frac{RT}{zF} \text{ln} \frac{1}{a_{\text{Fe}^{2+}}} \)
3:
\( \text{Cu}^{2+} + 2 ~\text{e}^- \longrightarrow \text{Cu} \hphantom{kkk} \\ \varepsilon_{c} = \varepsilon^{\circ}_{c} - \frac{RT}{zF} \text{ln} \frac{1}{a_{\text{Cu}^{2+}}} \)
4:
\( \text{Cu}^{2+} + 2 ~\text{e}^- \longrightarrow \text{Cu} \hphantom{kkk} \\ \varepsilon_{c} = \varepsilon^{\circ}_{c} - \frac{RT}{zF} \text{ln} a_{\text{Cu}^{2+}} \)

{1:MCS:%0% 1~%0% 2~%100% 3~%0% 4~ }

b) What is the anode reaction and its Nernst equation? (1 point)

1:
\( \text{Cu} \longrightarrow \text{Cu}^{2+} + 2 ~\text{e}^{-} \hphantom{kkk} \\ \varepsilon_{a} = \varepsilon^{\circ}_{a} - \frac{RT}{zF} \text{ln} \frac{1}{a_{\text{Cu}^{2+}}} \)
2:
\( \text{Fe} \longrightarrow \text{Fe}^{2+} + 2 ~\text{e}^{-} \hphantom{kkk} \\ \varepsilon_{a} = \varepsilon^{\circ}_{a} - \frac{RT}{zF} \text{ln} \frac{1}{a_{\text{Fe}^{2+}}} \)
3:
\( \text{Cu} \longrightarrow \text{Cu}^{2+} + 2 ~\text{e}^- \hphantom{kkk} \\ \varepsilon_{a} = \varepsilon^{\circ}_{a} - \frac{RT}{zF} \text{ln} a_{\text{Cu}^{2+}} \)
4:
\( \text{Fe} \longrightarrow \text{Fe}^{2+} + 2 ~\text{e}^- \hphantom{kkk} \\ \varepsilon_{a} = \varepsilon^{\circ}_{a} - \frac{RT}{zF} \text{ln} a_{\text{Fe}^{2+}} \)

{1:MCS:%0% 1~%100% 2~%0% 3~%0% 4~ }

c) What is the overall reaction in the galvanic cell? (1 point)

1:
\( \text{Fe} + \text{Cu}^{2+} \longrightarrow \text{Fe}^{2+} + \text{Cu} \)
2:
\( \text{Fe}^{2+} + \text{Cu} \longrightarrow \text{Fe} + \text{Cu}^{2+} \)

{1:MCS:%100% 1~%0% 2~ }

d) How would you justify your answer you gave in question c) ? (1 point)

{1:MCS:
~%0% The difference of standard electrode potentials is large and the temperature dependence of the electromotive force is large
~%0% The difference of standard electrode potentials is small and the temperature dependence of the electromotive force is small
~%0% The difference of standard electrode potentials is small and the temperature dependence of the electromotive force is large
~%100% The difference of standard electrode potentials is large and the temperature dependence of the electromotive force is small }

e) When the battery is discharged at 18.41 \(^{\circ}\)C , what will be the \( \text{Cu}^{2+}/\text{Fe}^{2+} \) activity ratio? (1 point)

{1:NM:%100%1.0348603000e-23:5.1743015000e-25}

g) What is the electromotive force at 18.41 \({^\circ}\)C ? Please give the answer in V! (2 points)

{2:NM:%100%6.5043329147e-01:3.2521664573e-02}

h) What is the Gibbs free energy change of the reaction at 18.41 \(^{\circ}\)C ? Please give the answer in kJ/mol (1 point)

{1:NM:%100%-1.2551411225e+02:6.2757056127e+00}

i) What is the enthalpy change of the reaction at 18.41 \(^{\circ}\)C ? Please give the answer in kJ/mol (1 point)

{1:NM:%100%-1.6804100953e+02:8.4020504763e+00}

j) What is the entropy change of the reaction at 18.41 \(^{\circ}\)C ? Please give the answer in J/(molK) (1 point)

{1:NM:%100%-1.4585984796e+02:7.2929923980e+00}
